hook.text: Shunryu Suzuki wrote: 'In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities. In the expert's, few.'

buildup.text: Expertise narrows perception. You stop seeing what's actually there because you think you already know.

discovery.text: Beginner's mind means approaching every experience with fresh curiosity, even familiar ones.

twist.text: The master pours tea into a full cup. It overflows. 'Empty your cup first,' the master says.

climax.text: To learn anything new, you must first let go of what you think you already know.

punchline.text: Stay curious. The cup is never really full.

quiz.question: What does 'beginner's mind' mean in Zen?
